emuInput.TitMainTitle: Comedian Timmie Rogers and Richard Shumann, holding Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, standing in Pittsburgh Courier office
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1953, pg. 22 reads: " 'I'd Love Me, If...!' - "I'd love me if I would pick up next week's edition of the Courier and see my face plastered from coast to coast on its theatrical pages," top-notch comedian Timmie Rogers tells Richard Shumann of the Pittsburgh office of the Capital Records Company, when the pair visited Managing Editor William G Nunn at the Courier's main plant in Pittsburgh last Wednesday. The trip was made to help promote Timmie Rogers' new record called "I'd Love Me," and its flip-side, also by Rogers, entitled "Saturday Night." - Harris Photo."
